intro: Piriqueta sidifolia, commonly known as the sidewalk spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which is known for its diverse and often strikingly ornamental species. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are surrounded by green bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to drought conditions. Piriqueta sidifolia is often found growing along roadsides and in disturbed soils, where it can spread readily.
